alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 29 at 2:55PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF MOLOKAI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Molokai in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 400 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 249 PM HST, radar indicated heavy to moderate rain over west Molokai or west of Kualapuu. Radar estimates that between 1 to 2 inches have already fallen over west Molokai. Rain is currently falling at an hourly rate of 1 to 2 inches. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Maunaloa, Kepuhi and Kualapuu. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 400 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
